channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: The Billionaire Space Race Is Really Heating Up
item.description: Just days after SpaceX pivoted to the Moon, Blue Origin’s new lunar strategy has come to light.

item.title: 'This is unacceptable' — SAG/AFTRA reacts to the viral Seedance 2.0 AI-generated Pitt-Cruise fight
item.description: Someone used ByteDance's Seedance 2.0 generative AI video platform to depict Tom Cruise fighting Brad Pitt, and no one in the film industry is happy about it.

item.title: Airbnb says a third of its customer support is now handled by AI in the US and Canada
item.description: Airbnb was poised to introduce an app that doesn't just search for you, but one that "knows you." CEO Brian Chesky said, "It will help guests plan their entire trip, help hosts better run their businesses, and help the company operate more efficiently at scale."

item.title: ‘Tower Dungeon’ Is Perfect for Readers Who Loved the Goofy, Grotesque Charm of ‘Delicious in Dungeon’
item.description: If you wished 'Delicious in Dungeon' was scarier right out of the gate, check out this dark fantasy manga about a lovable crew of adventurers.

item.title: What does this mean for EVs? 5 ways Trump’s big climate policy reversal could affect your next car purchase
item.description: President Trump’s reversal of the landmark ‘endangerment findings’ will cause major upset in the automotive industry – here’s what it could mean for electric vehicles.

item.title: The MG S5 is the SUV follow-up to one of the best EVs on the road – but is it anywhere near as charming?
item.description: The MG S5 is built on the same underpinnings as its award-winning hatchback counterpart, but it unfortunately lacks some of its predecessor’s excitement.

item.title: 5 horror movies to watch on Netflix, Prime Video, Disney+ and more this Valentine's Day
item.description: Cozy up and watch these great horror movies this Valentine's weekend.

item.title: OpenAI Is Nuking Its 4o Model. China’s ChatGPT Fans Aren’t OK
item.description: As OpenAI removed access to GPT-4o in its app on Friday, people who have come to rely on the chatbot for companionship are mourning the loss all over the world.

item.title: DoorDash drivers are getting paid to close Waymo car doors
item.description: Waymo is paying DoorDash drivers to close doors that are left ajar on their self-driving robotaxis.

item.title: Pourquoi la première bêta d’Android 17 est plus importante qu’il n’y paraît
item.description: Google accélère. La Android 17 Beta 1 vient de tomber, près un faux départ, et si elle semble avare en fonctions révolutionnaires au premier abord, elle cache une ambition stratégique majeure.

item.title: Android 17 Beta 1 est disponible : la liste des nouveautés et des Pixel compatibles
item.description: Google vient de mettre en ligne la première bêta d'Android 17. Ne cherchez pas de nouvelles icônes colorées ou des gadgets visuels, tout se passe sous le capot pour rendre le système enfin plus fluide sur tous les formats d'écran.

item.title: This Bizarre Star System Is Inside Out, and Astronomers Aren’t Sure How
item.description: A closer look at the planets around a star called LHS 1903 may just flip our understanding of how planetary systems form.

item.title: La première bêta d’Android 17 est finalement arrivée
item.description: Après un retard à l'allumage, Google a livré ce vendredi soir la première bêta d'Android 17. Destinée aux développeurs équipés d'un smartphone Pixel compatible, cette version n'est pas très riche en nouveautés — mais elle prépare le terrain à celles qui arrivent.

item.title: 41 popular hair extensions have toxic chemicals linked to cancer and other health risks
item.description: A new study shows these beauty products could be more dangerous than you think. The global market for hair extensions is booming, and projected to hit $14 billion by 2028. What was once a niche luxury item for women is now widely available.

item.title: A Dating App Based on Users’ Credit Scores Is Making a Comeback
item.description: Just ahead of Valentine's Day, Score wants to be more inclusive.

item.title: Bitcoin biopic starring Casey Affleck to use AI to generate locations and tweak performances
item.description: Killing Satoshi, an upcoming biopic about the elusive creator of Bitcoin, will reportedly rely heavily on artificial intelligence to generate locations and adjust actors' performances, Variety reports. The film was announced in 2025 as being directed by Doug Liman (The Bourne Identity, The Edge of Tomorrow) and starring Casey Affleck and Pete Davidson in undisclosed roles, but its connection to overhyped technology was previously understood to begin and end with cryptocurrency.According to a UK casting notice viewed by Variety, the producers of Killing Satoshi reserve the right to "change, add...

item.title: China has extracted 1000g of uranium from just seawater - targets "unlimited battery life" by 2050, tapping into 4.5 billion tons of aquatic uranium
item.description: The oceans hold vast uranium resources, and China’s recent extraction milestone is a start but does not yet ensure a large-scale fuel supply.

item.title: Fintech lending giant Figure confirms data breach
item.description: The company said hackers downloaded “a limited number of files” after breaking into an employee’s account. The hacking group ShinyHunters took responsibility for the breach.

item.title: 4chan’s creator says ‘Epstein had nothing to do’ with creating infamous far-right board /pol/
item.description: The close timing of Jeffrey Epstein coming into contact with 4chan founder Chris 'moot' Poole and the launch of the "politically incorrect" message board /pol/ that became a breeding ground for QAnon and the white supremacist alt-right movement was coincidental, says Poole. In a statement given to The Verge, Pool writes, "The decision to add […]

item.title: George R.R. Martin Makes Delightfully Terrible Mistake of Entrusting Major Spoilers to Small Child
item.description: Dexter Sol Ansell, who plays Egg on 'A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms,' shared some surprising insider info about main characters' futures.

item.title: OpenAI is retiring GPT-4o, and the AI relationships community is heartbroken
item.description: OpenAI retired the GPT-4o model on Feb. 13, the day before Valentine's Day. The AI relationships community is heartbroken.

item.title: The Verge’s 2026 Valentine’s Day gift guide (for him)
item.description: Valentine's Day is often thought of as the quintessential Hallmark holiday - and why wouldn't it be? Most of the time, it's marketed to us with massive floral arrangements and heart-shaped chocolates, both of which can come off as borderline twee. But no one says you have to play by the rulebook when it comes […]

item.title: Why top talent is walking away from OpenAI and xAI
item.description: AI companies have been hemorrhaging talent the past few weeks. Half of xAI’s founding team has left the company — some on their own, others through “restructuring” — while OpenAI is facing its own shakeups, from the disbanding of its mission alignment team to the firing of a policy exec who opposed its “adult mode” feature. Watch as TechCrunch’s Equity podcast hosts Kirsten Korosec, Anthony […]...

item.title: Bring KitchenAid's official color of the year into your home with mint green and brushed stainless steel accessories — from just $1.49
item.description: Drench your cooking space in this year's freshest color, paired with smart brushed stainless steel.

item.title: Corsair's pricey DDR5 RAM now comes in very different packaging — and it's all about foiling RAM scammers
item.description: Corsair is putting its high-end RAM in a sealed plastic clamshell to help prevent return-related scams.

item.title: I test smart home tech for a living, and these are the top 3 Ring alternative video doorbells I recommend, with local storage for your videos
item.description: With these wireless video doorbells you can avoid subscription fees and keep control of your recordings at home.

item.title: DIY Camera That Records on Cassette Tapes Takes Lo-Fi Tech Trends to a New Level
item.description: All the joy (and frustration) of 1983 at your fingertips!

item.title: The World Is on Fire, and Meta Sees an Opportunity to Add Facial Recognition to Smart Glasses
item.description: Meta reportedly hopes a 'dynamic political environment' will let them get away with a new surveillance network.

item.title: I tried to tell you about living in AI Time — this essay nails its harsh reality, and here's why we're not truly screwed
item.description: This is what it means to be living in AI Time and, based on a new essay by Matt Shumer, CEO and Co-Founder of Otherside, potentially how to survive it.

item.title: A mysterious Chinese company just teased its first cheap Micro Four Thirds camera – but don’t expect it to be an OM System killer
item.description: OM System has announced the entry of Chinese budget camera manufacturer Sonida into the Micro Four Thirds System, but the expected new Songdian-branded camera probably won't take on offerings from OM System or Lumix
